net.semanticmetadata.lire.builders

Interface DocumentBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLocalDocumentBuilder, GlobalDocumentBuilder, LocalDocumentBuilder, SimpleDocumentBuilder

    public interface DocumentBuilder

    Creating an Index

    Use DocumentBuilderFactory to create a DocumentBuilder, which will create Lucene Documents from images. Add this documents to an index like this: 

     System.out.println(">> Indexing " + images.size() + " files.");
 DocumentBuilder builder = DocumentBuilderFactory.getExtensiveDocumentBuilder();
 IndexWriter iw = new IndexWriter(indexPath, new SimpleAnalyzer(LuceneUtils.LUCENE_VERSION), true);
 int count = 0;
 long time = System.currentTimeMillis();
 for (String identifier : images) {
 Document doc = builder.createDocument(new FileInputStream(identifier), identifier);
 iw.addDocument(doc);
 count ++;
 if (count % 25 == 0) System.out.println(count + " files indexed.");
 }
 long timeTaken = (System.currentTimeMillis() - time);
 float sec = ((float) timeTaken) / 1000f;

 System.out.println(sec + " seconds taken, " + (timeTaken / count) + " ms per image.");
 iw.optimize();
 iw.close();

    This file is part of the Caliph and Emir project: http://www.SemanticMetadata.net
    Date: 31.01.2006
    Time: 23:02:00

    Author:
    Mathias Lux, mathias@juggle.at, Nektarios Anagnostopoulos, nek.anag@gmail.com

    • Method Detail

      • createDescriptorFields

        org.apache.lucene.document.Field[] createDescriptorFields(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Creates the feature fields for a Lucene Document without creating the document itself.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to analyze.
        Returns:
        the fields resulting from the analysis.

      • createDocument

        org.apache.lucene.document.Document createDocument(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                   java.lang.String identifier)
                                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a new Lucene document from a BufferedImage. The identifier can be used like an id (e.g. the file hashFunctionsFileName or the url of the image)
        Parameters:
        image - the image to index. Cannot be NULL.
        identifier - an id for the image, for instance the filename or a URL. Can be NULL.
        Returns:
        a Lucene Document containing the indexed image.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
